Class GUI

    • javafx.application.Application
      • src.GUI
  • public class GUI
extends javafx.application.Application
    GUI Class handles all the UI elements the player sees and interacts with.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

      • start

        public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        Sets up the UI layout and creates a scene to display the login page.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage -

      • setLoginPage

        private void setLoginPage()
        Sets up the login page.

        Creates and lays out all elements for the login page and also creates an event handler to set the player's username and start the game.

      • setDarkLight

        private void setDarkLight()
        Sets the game theme to dark or light mode.

        Sets out the dark and light mode buttons on the screen and uses two event handlers to change the theme when the corresponding button is clicked.

      • setLeaderboard1

        private void setLeaderboard1()
        Sets up the non-timed leaderboard.

        Creates a table with three columns:

        - "No." for placement in the leaderboard

        - "Name" for the player's name

        - "Score" for the player's score

        It sets the width and format for each column and adds them to the table.

      • setLeaderboard2

        private void setLeaderboard2()
        Sets up the non-timed leaderboard.

        Creates a table with four columns:

        - "No." for placement in the leaderboard

        - "Name" for the player's name

        - "Score" for the player's score

        It sets the width and format for each column and adds them to the table.

      • gameMode

        private void gameMode()
        Creates user interface for the player.

        Asks the player if they would like randomly assigned nodes for the game. If they say no, they are prompted to select the nodes they want. The game starts and they are prompted to guess and the guess handler is called to check the guess.

      • drawGraph

        private void drawGraph()
        Draws the graph on-screen.

        Provides a basic framework for visualising a graph by creating circles to represent vertices and placing them in random positions on the screen and connecting the relevant vertices with lines.

      • guessHandler

        private void guessHandler​(javafx.scene.control.TextField userGuess,
                          javafx.scene.control.TextField node1Input,
                          javafx.scene.control.TextField node2Input)
        Handles the guess input from the user.

        Called when the player clicks the guess button. It checks if the player has entered a guess, if they have then a new game object is created to get all the possible shortest paths and the overall shortest path and calculates the player's score and displays it on the screen.

        Parameters:
        userGuess -
        node1Input -
        node2Input -

      • showShortestPath

        private void showShortestPath()
        Shows the shortest path to the player by changing the color of the edges in the path to light blue.

      • showAllShortestPaths

        private void showAllShortestPaths()
        Loops through the list of shortest paths and changes the color of the edges in the path to a random color to distinguish them from the other edges, making it easier for the player to see.

      • showLeaderboard

        private void showLeaderboard()
        Shows the non-timed leaderboard to the player.

        Gets the list of players and their scores from the 'Players' text file and sorts them by score in descending order. Only the top 10 players are displayed on the leaderboard.

      • showLeaderboardWithTimers

        private void showLeaderboardWithTimers()
        Shows the timed leaderboard to the player.

        Gets the list of players, their scores, and their time from the 'PlayersIncTimers' text file and sorts them by score in descending order. Only the top 10 players are displayed on the leaderboard.

      • setTimeLabel

        private void setTimeLabel()
        Sets up the timer used for the game

        A TimeLabel is used to display the timer to the player on-screen. The format and font are set and the label is added to the 'rightLayout' vBox so it can be laid out in the top right corner of the scene.

        A timeline is created to use as the timer for the game. A new Timeline instance is created and a KeyFrame with an event that advances the timer by 1 second. The method then calls updateTimeLabel().

      • getGraph

        private int[][] getGraph()
        Gets the graph from the graph file.

        Imports the graph from the external file by creating a new game instance, the importGraph() method is used to import the graph into the game, and then uses the getAdjMatrix to return it from the game.

        Returns:

      • getRandomColor

        public javafx.scene.paint.Color getRandomColor()
        Gets a random color by generating 3 random integers between 0 and 256 and assigning them to the RGB values of a color.
        Returns:

      • startTimer

        private void startTimer()
        Starts the timer. Resets the secondsElapsed to 0, updates the on-screen timer and starts the timeline.
        See Also:
        setTimeLabel()

      • stopTimer

        private void stopTimer()
        Stops the timer by stopping the timeline.
        See Also:
        setTimeLabel()

      • updateTimeLabel

        private void updateTimeLabel()
        Updates the text shown to the player on-screen.

        Takes the seconds elapsed in the game and extracts the hours, minutes, and seconds out to set the text in the timeLabel that is shown to the player on-screen.

        See Also:
        setTimeLabel()
